intro: Downingia yina var. major, commonly known as the Sierra Lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. It has a compact, herbaceous growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Downingia yina var. major is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local insect populations.
